title: Epistemic Goal-Based Video Game-Enhanced Conceptual Change Education Course for Object Motion

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Process for inducing conceptual change in students' understanding of object motion within a game-based learning environment using digital devices. Provides safe yet interactive learning experiences replacing real lab environments via VR/simulation tools

learning_goals: Students can quantitatively analyze the angle-distance relationship to determine the optimal launch angle for reaching a target.
Students can identify and explain the key variables (initial velocity, angle, air resistance) that determine an object’s trajectory.
Students can critically evaluate the mass-velocity error concept based on data collected through experiments.

resources: Physics-based educational video games (e.g., Angry Birds or similar)
Digital tool for recording motion trajectories

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
